image.altText: An Aboriginal woman, wearing a patterned head scarf, navy blue top sitting in a bushland area.

props.synopsis: The Coalition will be hoping to win the Northern Territory seat of Lingiari for the first time this federal election, as a battle ensues to win over disillusioned voters in the bush.

title.children: Battle to win electorate with Australia's least engaged voters

image.altText: A Bureau of Meteorology tracking map

props.synopsis: A tropical low north off Darwin is heading south-west towards the Kimberley coast.

title.children: Late-season tropical cyclone highly likely off WA coast

image.altText: cutouts of women and men silhouettes under lit by candles.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has carved up a domestic violence forum to "focus on doing" but Aboriginal medical services have warned it "risks taking a step backward".

title.children: 'Focused on doing': NT government scraps domestic violence policy forum

image.altText: An aerial view of a blue river winding through green trees on its banks.

props.synopsis: An NT environment group has launched legal action against the government's Mataranka water plan, which allows 62,000 ML/year to be extracted from the aquifer feeding the iconic hot springs.

title.children: Environment group launches legal action against Mataranka water plan

image.altText: Wide aerial shot of Alice Springs street with bush and mountains in background

props.synopsis: A Danish tourist has left Alice Springs after she was punched and stomped on in an unprovoked attack, just hours after she arrived in town. A man has been charged over the incident.

title.children: Danish tourist knocked out in unprovoked attack leaves Alice Springs

image.altText: A young Aboriginal woman and man stand smiling in front of a large screen playing an animation, set up in the desert.

props.synopsis: The 10th annual Indigenous arts and culture festival in Alice Springs feels urgent as Australia gears up for the first federal election since the failed Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: This festival shifts the narrative about Indigenous peoples in Alice Springs

image.altText: Employment Minister Murray Watt with interview microphone, standing on a street outside.

props.synopsis: Murray Watt, Minister for Employment and Workplace Relations, says it's a "terrible thing" that Opposition Leader Peter Dutton was the subject of an alleged terror plot. Follow live.

title.children: 'Terrible thing': Labor minister speaks about alleged threat towards Dutton

image.altText: A crane vessel and rescue vessel in the river

props.synopsis: Officials say the tour aircraft lost control and hit the water upside down near Lower Manhattan. The helicopter tour company's owner said he had "no clue" why the crash happened.

title.children: Family of Spanish tourists killed in New York helicopter crash

image.altText: Wests Tigers fans enter Campbelltown Stadium

props.synopsis: The mayor of Campbelltown says if his council can secure an upgrade to its stadium, then Wests Tigers need to play most of their matches there. Follow live.

title.children: Mayor says $50 million stadium upgrade means Tigers must play more at Campbelltown

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Titans mix-up the order for Dragons clash
Alamoti fined for high tackle that sent him to sin bin
Catch up on Thursday's NRL action

image.altText: A close up of Lucy Markovic, wearing her hair in a bob with a middle part and a serious expression on her face

props.synopsis: The model told fans she needed surgery because of an arteriovenous malformation (AVM) "the size of a golf ball".

title.children: Australia's Next Top Model's Lucy Markovic dies at the age of 27

image.altText: Composite of pop star Katy Perry wear oragne outfit with white background, left, with Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry, right

props.synopsis: Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry has secured a hearing in the court after earlier losing an appeal over the use of the homophonous name as a trademark by the US singer.

title.children: Katy Perry v Katie Perry trademark saga to be heard by High Court

image.altText: Collage of electricity bill behind a green mountain with powerlines on orange background.

props.synopsis: We take a closer look at the average power bill to see which sections Australians should be keeping an eye on or asking questions about.

title.children: Understanding power bills and how consumers are using this to save

image.altText: A passenger jet on tarmac as seen through a chain-link fence.

props.synopsis: Corporate regulator ASIC has decided not to take action against the directors of the budget regional airline following its collapse last year.

title.children: Bonza directors avoid prosecution despite insolvent trading allegations

image.altText: taiwan coast guard stop and detain a cargo ship in the taiwan straight

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say the man was captain of the Chinese-crewed but Togolese-registered ship Hong Tai 58, which is accused of damaging a cable with its anchor.

title.children: Taiwan charges Chinese ship captain with damaging undersea cables

image.altText: A number of officials pose for a picture next to a grey weapon

props.synopsis: The Defence Department told the ABC that “Australia has not supplied weapons or ammunition to Israel” since the Gaza war began in 2023.

title.children: Australian weapon trialled by Israel's military ahead of potential sale

image.altText: a man in a suit with the photo showing his side profile

props.synopsis: Former South Australian Liberal Party leader David Speirs started using cocaine in June 2024 when it was offered to him by a "third party" to cope with stress, a court has heard.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader used cocaine as 'escapism', court hears

image.altText: A photo of the Nickel factory sitting by the coast under blue skies.

props.synopsis: A billion-dollar bet on nickel mining gave many New Caledonians hopes of economic prosperity and political independence. But after the market turned, the mine has left behind a ghost town full of broken hearts.

title.children: 'We are in the s**t': Mine's closure cripples Pacific indigenous community

image.altText: Bailey Smith gives double middle fingers to a fan after the Geelong Cats' win over Adelaide Crows.

props.synopsis: Geelong star Bailey Smith is waiting to see how much he will be fined for flipping off a fan in Adelaide after the Cats' win over the Crows.

title.children: Smith says he 'shouldn't have done the double bird' at Adelaide fan

image.altText: An aerial view of crops in vast open country.

props.synopsis: A controversial mining project in northern Victoria has been cleared to proceed despite staunch community opposition.

title.children: New mine gets 20-year licence despite fears land will be 'scarred forever'

image.altText: Annette looks into the camera with a solemn expression, a photo of her deceased son hangs on the wall.

props.synopsis: Australian Super is one of two super funds being sued by ASIC over the handling of death benefit claims. A First Nations family says a deceased family member was mistreated by the fund.

title.children: A super payment went to the wrong account but the fund says it's not to blame

image.altText: Salih

props.synopsis: Palestinian paramedic Salih Muamar was killed by Israeli soldiers in an incident that has sparked international condemnation.  A relative in Australia says he expects no-one will be held to account.

title.children: Australian educator says Israeli probe into relative's killing in Gaza 'means nothing'

image.altText: Viola Davis holds a gun overhead and looks to the camera with a steely expression in front of her car with US flags on it.

props.synopsis: There are movies you'd expect to see Viola Davis star in, and there are those you wouldn't. G20 is the latter.

title.children: Why is Oscar-winner Viola Davis in a straight-to-streaming action flick?

image.altText: Two men wearing suits speak

props.synopsis: Election results trigger, or subsequently lead to, leadership resets. Even in the turmoil of a campaign, players will also have their eyes on the future.

title.children: Will both parties see a leadership change in the next parliament?

image.altText: A skinny, dark-coated dog wearing a brightly coloured collar.

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier woman has received a suspended prison sentence after admitting to the ill treatment of six dogs in her care.

title.children: Woman avoids jail after dogs found starving in SA home

image.altText: A close-up photo of Jaden with his arm around Kelly, both a smiling

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old Perth man who fatally stabbed a teenager during a botched, phoney drug deal is sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: 'Acting like gangsters': 21yo jailed for murder in fake drug deal

image.altText: A purple lightning strike fills the sky.

props.synopsis: The corporate watchdog alleges delays by Hollard Insurance over a storm damage claim left a Victorian couple with no choice but to demolish their home.

title.children: Major insurer taken to court over 'egregious' handling of storm claim

image.altText: Fossil jawbone as seen from the right.

props.synopsis: An analysis of a jawbone found off the Taiwanese coast reveals it belonged to a Denisovan, a mysterious human species that contributed some genetic material to Indigenous Australians and people living in Asia today.

title.children: Enigmatic extinct cousin of modern humans confirmed in Taiwan

image.altText: A soldier is seen partially inside a tank.

props.synopsis: By the time MP Mike Martin described it as "inevitable" last month, conscription was well and truly back in Britain's national conversation, and some people are not against the idea.

title.children: Conscription is 'inevitable' for UK, says MP eyeing war with Russia

image.altText: prince harry speaks to a ukraine soldier at a hospital

props.synopsis: He visited the Superhumans Center in the western Ukraine city of Lviv to meet with wounded soldiers from the ongoing conflict with Russia.

title.children: Prince Harry meets war injured in surprise trip to Ukraine

image.altText: woman sitting opposite a fan

props.synopsis: Look back at the advice from our panel of health experts on all your questions about perimenopause.

title.children: Health experts answered your questions about perimenopause — as it happened

image.altText: Woman with glasses wearing light pink jumper standing outside in park amid trees

props.synopsis: As the federal election debate builds around Australia's migration numbers and the effect on the housing crisis, members of the Indian diaspora say they are witnessing a growing wave of online racism. At the same time, they watch on as politicians make "performative" gestures to try to win their vote.

title.children: 'You scapegoat me and then you want my vote?': Indian diaspora carries weight of online racism

image.altText: Donald Trump points angrily on a red carpet, a largue statue of an Oscar behind him.

props.synopsis: Plus, Cannes Film Festival slate announced and how to watch Lady Gaga's Coachella set.

title.children: Why China's hit against Hollywood should have Trump worried

image.altText: Papers fly in office as Chinese-American woman with long dark hair wearing floral shirt and red vest performs kung fu move.

props.synopsis: Following years of impassioned calls, the Academy Awards will be introducing the Best Stunt Design category at the 100th annual Oscars.

title.children: Oscars add Best Stunt category — here are five films that could have won

image.altText: A woman in a pick top stands in front of a man wearing a blue suit with a map graphic behind them.

props.synopsis: With a 0.2 per cent margin, high-profile candidates expect preferences to again decide the winner in Gilmore as Labor's Fiona Phillips faces former NSW Liberal minister Andrew Constance.

title.children: Disrupter enters fray in battle for ultra-marginal NSW seat
